009
010package imagingbook.common.image.access;
011
012import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
013import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
014import imagingbook.common.interpolation.InterpolationMethod;
015
016/**
017 * <p>
018 * An 'image accessor' is a wrapper around some {@link ImageProcessor} object to allow
019 * unified (read and write) access to its pixels values.
020 * This abstract class defines unified access functionality to all 4 types of images available in ImageJ:
021 * 8-bit, 16-bit, float, and color images.
022 * All pixel values are of type {@code float[]}, either containing a single element (for
023 * scalar-valued images) or three elements (for color images).
024 * </p>
025 * <p>
026 * A generic {@link ImageAccessor} is created, e.g., by {@link #create(ImageProcessor)}, which
027 * returns an instance of {@link ByteAccessor}, {@link ShortAccessor}, {@link FloatAccessor} or
028 * {@link RgbAccessor}.
029 * {@link ImageAccessor} itself can access any ImageJ image using 
030 * the methods {@link #getPix(int, int)}, {@link #getPix(double, double)}
031 * for retrieving pixel values and {@link #setPix(int, int, float[])}
032 * to modify pixel values.
033 * </p>
034 * <p>
035 * In addition, the accessors for scalar-valued images ({@link ByteAccessor}, {@link ShortAccessor},
036 * {@link FloatAccessor}) provide the methods
037 * {@link ScalarAccessor#getVal(int, int)}, {@link ScalarAccessor#getVal(double, double)} and 
038 * {@link ScalarAccessor#setVal(int, int, float)}
039 * to read and write scalar-valued pixels passed as single {@code float} values.
040 * <br>
041 * The methods {@link #getPix(double, double)} and {@link ScalarAccessor#getVal(double, double)} perform interpolation at non-integer coordinates
042 * using the specified {@link InterpolationMethod}.
043 * </p>
044 * 
045 * @author WB
046 * @version 2020/12/27
047 */
048public abstract class ImageAccessor {
049        
050        static final OutOfBoundsStrategy DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy = OutOfBoundsStrategy.ZeroValues;
051        static final InterpolationMethod DefaultInterpolationMethod = InterpolationMethod.Bilinear;
052        
053        protected final ImageProcessor ip;
054        protected final int width;
055        protected final int height;
056        protected final GridIndexer2D indexer;          // implements the specified OutOfBoundsStrategy
057        protected final OutOfBoundsStrategy outOfBoundsStrategy;
058        protected final InterpolationMethod interpolationMethod;
059        
060        /**
061         * Creates a new {@code ImageAccessor} instance for the given image,
062         * using the default out-of-bounds strategy and interpolation methods.
063         * The concrete type of the returned instance depends on the specified image.
064         * 
065         * @param ip the source image
066         * @return a new {@code ImageAccessor} instance
067         */
068        public static final ImageAccessor create(ImageProcessor ip) {
069                return create(ip, DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy, DefaultInterpolationMethod);
070        }
071        
072        /**
073         * Creates a new {@code ImageAccessor} instance for the given image,
074         * using the specified out-of-bounds strategy and interpolation methods.
075         * The concrete type of the returned instance depends on the specified image.
076         * 
077         * @param ip the source image
078         * @param obs the out-of-bounds strategy (use {@code null} for default settings)
079         * @param ipm the interpolation method (use {@code null} for default settings)
080         * @return a new {@code ImageAccessor} instance
081         */
082        public static ImageAccessor create(ImageProcessor ip,  OutOfBoundsStrategy obs, InterpolationMethod ipm) {
083                if (ip instanceof ColorProcessor) {
084                        return new RgbAccessor((ColorProcessor)ip, obs, ipm);
085                }
086                else {
087                        return ScalarAccessor.create(ip, obs, ipm);
088                }
089        }
090        
091        // constructor (used by all subtypes)
092        protected ImageAccessor(ImageProcessor ip, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs, InterpolationMethod ipm) {
093                this.ip = ip;
094                this.width  = ip.getWidth();
095                this.height = ip.getHeight();
096                this.outOfBoundsStrategy = (obs != null) ? obs : DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy;
097                this.interpolationMethod = (ipm != null) ? ipm : DefaultInterpolationMethod;
098                this.indexer = GridIndexer2D.create(width, height, this.outOfBoundsStrategy);
099        }
100        
101        /**
102         * Returns the width of the associated image.
103         * @return the image width.
104         */
105        public int getWidth() {
106                return this.width;
107        }
108        
109        /**
110         * Returns the height of the associated image.
111         * @return the image height.
112         */
113        public int getHeight() {
114                return this.height;
115        }
116        
117        /**
118         * Returns the source {@link ImageProcessor} associated with this
119         * {@link ImageAccessor}.
120         * 
121         * @return the image processor
122         */
123        public ImageProcessor getProcessor() {
124                return this.ip;
125        }
126        
127        /**
128         * Returns the depth (number of components) of this image
129         * accessor. 1 is returned if the image is scalar-valued.
130         * 
131         * @return the image depth.
132         */
133        public abstract int getDepth();
134        
135        /**
136         * Returns the {@link OutOfBoundsStrategy} specified for this
137         * {@link ImageAccessor}.
138         * 
139         * @return the out-of-bounds strategy
140         */
141        public OutOfBoundsStrategy getOutOfBoundsStrategy() {
142                return outOfBoundsStrategy;
143        }
144
145        /**
146         * Returns the {@link InterpolationMethod} specified for this
147         * {@link ImageAccessor}.
148         * 
149         * @return the interpolation method
150         */
151        public InterpolationMethod getInterpolationMethod() {
152                return interpolationMethod;
153        }
154        
155        /**
156         * Returns the pixel value for the specified floating-point 
157         * position as a {@code float[]} with either 1 element for scalar-valued images
158         * and or more elements (e.g., 3 for for RGB images).
159         * 
160         * @param u the x-coordinate
161         * @param v the y-coordinate
162         * @return the pixel value ({@code float[]})
163         */
164        public abstract float[] getPix(int u, int v);
165        
166        /**
167         * Returns the interpolated pixel value for the specified floating-point 
168         * position as a {@code float[]} with either 1 element for scalar-valued images
169         * and or more elements (e.g., 3 for for RGB images).
170         * Interpolation is used non-integer coordinates.
171         * 
172         * @param x the x-coordinate
173         * @param y the y-coordinate
174         * @return the interpolated pixel value ({@code float[]})
175         */
176        public abstract float[] getPix(double x, double y);             // returns interpolated pixel value at real position (x, y)
177        
178        /**
179         * Sets the pixel value at the specified integer position.
180         * The new value must be provided as {@code float[]} with 
181         * 1 element for scalar-valued images or 3 elements for RGB images.
182         * @param u the x-coordinate
183         * @param v the y-coordinate
184         * @param val the new pixel value ({@code float[]})
185         */
186        public abstract void setPix(int u, int v, float[] val);
187        
188        /**
189         * Returns the value of the pixel's k-th component at the
190         * specified position. If the associated image is scalar-valued,
191         * this is equivalent to component 0.
192         * See also {@link #getDepth()}.
193         * 
194         * @param u the x-coordinate
195         * @param v the y-coordinate
196         * @param k the component index
197         * @return the component value ({@code float})
198         */
199        public abstract float getVal(int u, int v, int k);
200        
201        
202        /**
203         * Returns the interpolated value of the pixel's k-th component at the
204         * specified position. If the associated image is scalar-valued,
205         * this is equivalent to component 0.
206         * See also {@link #getDepth()}.
207         * 
208         * @param x the x-coordinate
209         * @param y the y-coordinate
210         * @param k the component index
211         * @return the interpolated component value ({@code float[]})
212         */
213        public abstract float getVal(double x, double y, int k);
214        
215        /**
216         * Sets the value of the pixel's k-th component at the
217         * specified position. If the associated image is scalar-valued,
218         * this is equivalent to component 0.
219         * See also {@link #getDepth()}.
220         * 
221         * @param u the x-coordinate
222         * @param v the y-coordinate
223         * @param k the component index
224         * @param val the new component value
225         */
226        public abstract void setVal(int u, int v, int k, float val);
227        
228        /**
229         * Returns the {@link ImageAccessor} for the k-th component;
230         * the result is a sub-type of {@link ScalarAccessor}.
231         * In the case of a scalar-valued image, THIS object is returned.
232         * 
233         * @param k the component index
234         * @return the component accessor.
235         */
236        public abstract ScalarAccessor getComponentAccessor(int k);
237        
238        protected abstract void checkComponentIndex(int k);
239                
240}
